# f5xc_ticket_tracking_system (Resource)

Create Ticket Tracking System

~> **Note** For more information about this resource, please refer to the [F5 XC API Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/api/).

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "f5xc_ticket_tracking_system" "example" {
  name      = "example"
  namespace = "system"

  labels = {
    "env" = "production"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the TicketTrackingSystem. Must be unique within the namespace.
- `namespace` (String) Namespace where the TicketTrackingSystem will be created.

### Optional

- `annotations` (Map of String) Annotations to apply to this resource.
- `jira_config` (Block, Optional) Jira Configuration Type. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--jira_config))
- `labels` (Map of String) Labels to apply to this resource.

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the resource.

<a id="nestedblock--jira_config"></a>
### Nested Schema for `jira_config`

Optional:

- `adhoc_rest_api` (Block, Optional) JIRA Ad-hoc REST API Configuration Type. v3 API Basic Auth for Ad-hoc API Calls - https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/ This message represents what is stored in the XC database. To see the API format, refer to the JiraAdhocRestApiConfigurationSpec message (see [below for nested schema](#nestedblock--jira_config--adhoc_rest_api))

<a id="nestedblock--jira_config--adhoc_rest_api"></a>
### Nested Schema for `jira_config.adhoc_rest_api`

Optional:

- `account_email` (String) Account Email. Username (email) for the Atlassian account Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.email: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1
- `api_token` (String) API Token. API Token (password) specified by the customer in plaintext to be used for Basic Auth. This value is purely used for user input and is not persisted in the database. It will be converted to a blindfolded and encrypted form before saving. For editing/replacing the existing JIRA configuration, and to use the already stored value of the encrypted API Token, this field should be sent as an empty string. Since this field is confidential, the Get/List public APIs will return this value a...
- `organization_domain` (String) Organization Domain. A valid hostname for the Atlassian organization, as defined by RFC 1034 Required: YES ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.hostname: true ves.io.schema.rules.string.min_len: 1

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Import using namespace/name format
terraform import f5xc_ticket_tracking_system.example system/example
```
